content:
• Friday, November 1, 2013
  • ELLI

    Ellie Mae hit with downgrade following Q3 miss, others defend

    • Its shares propped up in recent months by M&A hopes, Ellie Mae (ELLI -16.9%) tumbled to levels last seen in July after missing Q3 estimates and issuing below-consensus Q4 guidance, while blaming (among other things) a major slowdown in mortgage applications.
    • Dougherty has cut the mortgage-origination software vendor to Neutral. The firm sees declining loan origination volumes leading Ellie to "face stiffer headwinds" in 2014, and is also worried heavy spending - opex rose 28% Y/Y in Q3 - will pressure margins.
    • But Needham and FBR defended the company: The former says Ellie's report is "[by] no means a disaster" given industry trends, and the latter is pleased with ongoing user and bookings growth; active users for Ellie's core Encompass loan origination platform rose 39% Y/Y to 93.6K.
    • In tandem with its report, Ellie Mae announced it's acquiring MortgageCEO, a provider of CRM (sales) and marketing automation (ad campaign management) software for mortgage providers. Ellie Mae asserts MortgageCEO's offerings complement Encompass, and will help its clients drive loan volumes.
    • The purchase comes at a time when M&A interest in cloud marketing automation firms has heated up.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:03 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top Gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: IQNT +10.8%. SSNI +9.2%. OCN +5.5%. TASR +5.2%. EGOV +4.7%.
    • Top Losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EPAY -9.3%. HWAY -7.5%. PVA -7.3%. GTAT -6.9%. GTI -6.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • SANM

    Sanmina replacing OfficeMax in S&P SmallCap 600

    • With OfficeMax having been cleared by regulators to merge with Office Depot, Sanmina (NASDAQ:SANM) will be taking the company's place in the S&P SmallCap 600 following the Nov. 15 close.
    • SANM +3.6% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM | 1 Comment

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: FXI +3.87%. UUP +1.96%. EPI +1.49%. XLP +1.14%. HDV +0.83%.
    • Losers: GDXJ -12.24%. GAZ -8.62%. GDX -8.54%. UNG -7.76%. URA -6.43%.
       
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • PDCE

    PDC Energy downgraded at Miller Tabak on valuation

    • PDC Energy (PDCE -6.3%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $69 price target at Miller Tabak on valuation.
    • The firm says PDCE remains one of its favorite E&Ps thanks to a large inventory of future drilling locations in the core areas of the Wattenberg and Utica, and several data points in the coming months - Utica EUR assumption, results from the Neill and other Utica wells, December production and capex guidance - could offer an opportunity to revisit the rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • ANH

    Anworth loses Buy rating at KBW

    • The stock now rates a Hold with $5 price target following last night's earnings report. Relative to some of the other mortgage REITs, Anworth's (ANH -4.1%) results weren't horrible.
    • Book value fell 2%, but the company earned its $0.12 dividend. Net interest income slipped 18 basis points to a barely visible 0.82% as funding costs increased. Prepayments, however, didn't see a spike like other ARMs players Capstead Mortgage and Hatteras Financial.
    • Anworth earnings coverage.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • ALPMY

    Astellas reports Xtandi sales, Medivation rallies

    • Astellas Pharma (OTCPK:ALPMY) reports H1 consolidated net sales ( ¥ millions) of ¥556,702, up 16.7% Y/Y.
    • Net income ( ¥ millions) for H1 falls 16% Y/Y to ¥48.195. (full results)
    • Xtandi U.S. sales of ~$190M for April-September. (supplementary documents)
    • Backing out FQ1 sales of $82M gets ~$108M in U.S. Xtandi sales for FQ2.
    • These numbers are likely behind the rally in shares of Medivation (MDVN +10.1%), Astellas' Xtandi partner.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • CHTR

    Reuters: Charter Communications weighing bid for Time Warner

    • Time Warner Cable (TWC +4.2%) shares spike on a rumor that Charter Communications (CHTR +2.3%) is weighing a bid for the cable operator by the end of year.
    • Update: the speculation comes from Reuters, which cites sources.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • FRO

    Oil tanker rates surge on rising Chinese demand for cargoes

    • Rates for the largest oil tankers are surging, as Chinese freight traders lead an acceleration in Asian demand for the ships to load Middle East crude, sapping a fleet surplus that had made the carriers unprofitable almost all year.
    • A VLCC built 16 years ago reportedly was hired today at ~13% more than yesterday’s prevailing prices, for the biggest one-day gain in 2013; rising demand has cut a capacity surplus to the smallest since June 4, according to a Bloomberg survey.
    • FRO +9.4%, SFL +0.8%, NAT +3%, TK +1.3%, TNK +0.1%, TOO +0.1%, TGP -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • SWN

    Southwestern Energy raised to Buy at Stifel, citing positive well results

    • Southwestern Energy (SWN +2.3%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $43 price target at Stifel after Q3 results including above-guidance production and an operational update that included a positive vertical well result in the Brown Dense and improving initial production rates in the Fayetteville on what appear to be improved completion techniques.
    • The firm thinks early indications from Fayetteville suggest SWN could move lower on the cost curve and have higher growth rates, which could lead to meaningful upside to the 2014 production outlook; guidance is expected in December.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources rallies on positive commentary

    • Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +7.2%) pushes higher a day after reporting a smaller than expected Q3 loss, prompting an upgrade to Market Perform from Underperform at Raymond James.
    • The firm likes ANR's current liquidity position, reduced financial covenants through 2016 and improved cost outlook but will wait for more clarity on a met coal pricing recovery before getting more constructive.
    • ANR announced a further planned $200M reduction to costs with its 2014 guidance; if achieved, it represents a swing to free cash flow positive in 2015 using a met coal price assumption of $170/metric ton, the firm says.
    • Cowen raises its price target for ANR shares to $9 from $7.50, attracted by an improved financial position and potential profitability from a continued met recovery (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 7 Comments
  • CVX

    Chevron increases spending guidance, shares -1.5%

    • Investors don't like what they heard from Chevron (CVX -1.5%) on spending, as the company said in its earnings call that it spent $10.6B in Q3 for capital and exploratory costs, higher even than Exxon's $10.5B.
    • CFO Patricia Yarrington said CVX's spending this year would finish ~10% higher than planned but would flatten out once huge Australian liquefied natural gas projects are out of the way. (Q3 earnings)
    • Both companies are spending at historic levels as they invest in massive projects aimed at boosting their oil and gas output; XOM has still spent more than CVX through the first nine months of 2013, $32.6B vs. $28.9B.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • VRTX

    Bernstein downgrades Vertex, shares fall

    • Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -5.6%) is trading notably lower on the session.
    • Likely behind the move is Bernstein, where analysts have downgraded the shares to Market Perform from Outperform.
    • Price target is $75.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar strikes 100MW module supply deal

    • China's Three Gorges New Energy plans to use 100MW worth of Canadian Solar (CSIQ +7.9%) modules in a project set to finish by December; deliveries have already begun. (PR)
    • Canadian Solar is making new highs thanks to the deal, and also due to First Solar's blowout Q3. Shares +629% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney trudges up on no apparent news

    • Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +10.3%) are trudging up without any apparent news.
    • With short interest representing a breath-taking 52% of the float as of Oct. 15, bears may be taking profit (short interest declined 8% since Sept. 30) but could also be facing a squeeze.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • GOLD

    Barrick's dilution may have miner shareholders fearing they're next

    • Barrick Gold's (ABX -6.2%) planned $3B capital raise may be "prudent and necessary" for the company, but it stinks for shareholders, and shares of other big precious metals miners are tumbling too.
    • ABX's move may be sparking fears from shareholders in other miners that they could be next, and that stock offerings of this size could make it hard to raise dividends in the future; "cram-down financing like this is something that companies should consider [only] after their stocks have rallied significantly," Jon Ogg writes.
    • NEM -4.7%, GG -3.8%, KGC -3.9%, SLW -3.2%, GFI -1.3%, NGD -2.2%, AUY -3.3%, CDE -3.3%, TAHO -4.9%.
    • ETFs: GDX, GDXJ, NUGT, DUST, GLDX, GGGG, RING, PSAU, JNUG.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 10 Comments
  • IDIX

    Idenix rally may be linked to AASLD meeting: Deutsche

    • Deutsche's Alethia Young thinks the rally in shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +41%) may be attributable to the upcoming AASLD meeting which begins this weekend.
    • Here's Young: "IDIX has noted that they are not interested in an exclusive arrangement with JNJ or anyone else [but] we would assume that any HCV developer would be interested in a nuke."
    • IDIX's HELIX-1 trial is evaluating the company's NS5A inhibitor, samatasvirin in combination with JNJ's simeprevir.
    • Deutsche has the shares at Hold.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • RASF

    RAIT putting money to work

    • It's day number two of big gains for RAIT Financial Trust (RAS +2.5%) following Q3 results reported yesterday morning in which adjusted FFO per share gained 10% Y/Y to $0.33.
    • The company originated $167.5M of loans in Q3, up from just $21.6M a year ago, and purchased a 288-unit apartment complex in Texas for $30M. Rental income of $29.2M gained 11% from last year.
    • On the earnings call (transcript), management says it's expanding its loan origination team and expects production to continue to trend higher. As for that big jump of 11% in rental income in Q3, management calls that an outlier and dials back investor expectations going forward.
    • Also helping is the performance of Independence Realty Trust (NYSEMKT:IRT) - of which RAS still holds a 60% stake (5.8M shares). After a tough time post-IPO this summer, the stock has bounced back and is now north of the offering price. IRT itself reported inline earnings and a revenue beat this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: SCKT +37%. IDIX +38%. HXM +33%. OSIR +25%. IRIX +22%. FSLR +18%. GDOT +16%. DRAD +16%. TRMB +14%. GNK +14%.
    • Top 10 Losers: OTCQB:BODY -28%. ACW -27%. HTCH -19%. ESIO -17%. SHEN -17%. ELLI -18%. FPRX -14%. PED -13%. GALT -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • CVI

    CVR Energy profit plummets, shares sink

    • CVR Energy (CVI -7.5%) is sharply lower after reporting a 79% decline in Q3 earnings, impacted by unprecedented downtime related to the Fluid Catalytic Cracking Unit outage at CVR Refining's (CVRR -11.8%) Coffeyville refinery (CVRR Q3 earnings).
    • Also, crude differentials tightened in late August and crack spreads and product basis weakened during the quarter, further impacting results.
    • Net income attributable to CVI stockholders was $44M, or $0.51/share, vs. $209M, or $2.41/share, last year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • LKM

    NQ turns negative after Block makes Bloomberg TV appearance

    • "We have no doubt that in a year from now, this company will have been delisted," said Muddy Waters' Carson Block during a Bloomberg TV talk (video) about NQ Mobile (NQ -7.7%). NQ has given up its early gains in response.
    • Block compares this week's rebound in NQ shares to one temporarily seen in shares of China MediaExpress, a 2011 Muddy Waters target that was delisted a few months after the short-seller took aim.
    • He estimates once more over 90% of NQ's revenue is fake, and discusses MW's on-the-ground research, which (among other things) found no offices for major NQ customer Yidatong (accused by MW of being a shell company) at several listed addresses.
    • NQ issued a presentation last weekend in which it defended its relationship with Yidatong, arguing payments between the companies have been "transparently disclosed" and posting pictures of Yidatong's main office in Beijing.
    • More on NQ Mobile
    • Update (2:21PM ET): NQ co-CEO Omar Khan appeared on Bloomberg TV to counter Block's claims (video). His appearance didn't do much to lift NQ's shares, which are now down 10.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 29 Comments
  • OSIR

    Osiris Therapeutics rises sharply as management addresses Grafix controversy

    • Shares of Osiris Therapeutics (OSIR +27.7%) soar following the company's Q3 results.
    • Revenue rises 220% from Q3 2012 and gross margin expands by 254%. The company notes that it is now profitable and cash flow positive.
    • Management addresses the controversy surrounding Grafix on the CC, calling the FDA agreement "favorable."
    • Here's what the company says about Grafix: As "a wound cover for the treatment of acute and chronic wounds," the FDA has affirmed the product is regulated solely as a HCT/P. This "includes DFU" and a BLA "is not required for Grafix to remain on the market."
    • The company "can apply for a BLA for enhanced claims."
    • Conference call and slides are here
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon rallies after site, apps overhauled

    • The latest changes to Groupon's (GRPN +6.2%) site and apps are an extension of the company's ongoing efforts to transform from a mere provider of daily deals (largely monetized via e-mail) into a "marketplace" for personalized deals (many of which are long-term) that users frequently browse and search through.
    • A list of personalized deals (based on prior user activity) now appears on Groupon's homepage, and a prominent search bar appears on every page. Groupon's search tools have been updated to include filters and auto-suggestions, as well as a wider variety of deals.
    • Groupon has also updated its mobile apps to include the search and personalized deal changes, and has added a Local Explorer feature that sends deals based on a user's location.
    • Direct e-mail now accounts for less than 40% of Groupon's North American transactions, and mobile accounts for nearly 50%. Q3 results are due on Nov. 7.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 4 Comments
  • AGI

    Alamos Gold drops after three downgrades, one upgrade

    • Alamos Gold (AGI -8.5%) suffers several downgrades following Q3 results that were in line with expectations given a strong performance from the heap leach offset by the processing of lower grades.
    • RBC Capital is one of at least three downgrades, saying although it continues to believe AGI is one of the best positioned gold equities, it cut its rating to Sector Perform from Outperform given limited upside to its price target of $18.
    • TD Securities and Raymond James also cut shares to Buy/Market Perform based on valuation (I, II).
    • Canaccord dissents with consensus, upgrading AGI to Buy from Hold and saying the premium is justified in light of the attractive low-cost production growth profile and a cash-rich debt-free balance sheet.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment

  • Dollar continues nice run

    • Boosted earlier in the week by a slow European inflation print, the dollar (UUP +0.6%) continues a nice run following a (barely) hawkish Fed Wednesday, and strong regional and national manufacturing data yesterday and today.
    • The biggest move has come against the euro (FXE), where ECB rate cut hopes arise after EU annual CPI came in at just 0.7% in October vs. consensus 1.1%. Core CPI of 0.8% fell from 1% previously. Pushing $1.40 and having the bears avoiding margin clerks one week ago, the euro now is buying just $1.3485.
    • Euro ETFs: FXE, EUO, ERO, DRR, EUFX, ULE, URR.
    • Dollar ETFs: UUPT, UDN, UDNT.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • IDIX

    Idenix soars on huge volume

    • Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +32.8%) are on-the-move this morning, trading sharply higher on heavy volume.
    • Although there are no readily apparent catalysts for the move, the company did give an HCV pipeline update Wednesday along with its Q3 report.
    • Summary: Enrollment initiated for IDX21437 Phase 1/2, enrollment complete in HELIX-1 (that's the samatasvir/ simeprevir/ ribavirin GT1b and GT4 trial) with SVR4 data expected in Q4.
    • Also of note, IDIX said its cash "will be sufficient to sustain its operations through December 2014." (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • HOS

    Hornbeck Offshore slides after Wunderlich downgrade

    • Hornbeck Offshore (HOS -3.7%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with $61 price target, down from $70, at Wunderlich.
    • The firm sees a less optimistic progression for dayrates for the company's new generation offshore support vessels in light of an influx of newbuild vessels in the Gulf of Mexico, which may slow positive dayrate progression until H2 2014.
    • The firm cuts its 2013 EPS estimate to $2.39 from $2.52 and reduces its 2014 EPS estimate to $3.62 from $4.58.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar soars in spite of muted analyst commentary, peers also up

    • A solid majority of analysts covering First Solar (FSLR +15.5%) have maintained neutral ratings for a while, even as shares took off as part of a broader solar rally, and none have issued upgrades following the company's huge Q3 beat and mixed full-year guidance.
    • Deutsche (Hold) estimates early revenue recognition for the Desert Sunlight project provided a $0.15 Q3 EPS boost, and that a lower tax rate and operational improvements provided a $0.25 boost. The firm sees "limited upside to 2014 estimates."
    • Needham (Hold) offers a similar take: It's encouraged by First Solar's cost improvements and rising bookings, but is worried about the potential for lower 2014 earnings and "uncertainty" regarding 2015 growth.
    • First Solar mentioned on its CC (transcript) its core module cost/watt ($0.49) is the "lowest in the industry" following a big Q3 drop - the company's cost advantage has been narrowing in recent years as polysilicon prices crash - and that it's testing modules with a 14.1% conversion efficiency; average Q2 efficiency was 13.3%, and lead-line efficiency 13.9%. Ont the other hand, First Solar says it's seeing a "lower system ASP environment."
    • 16.8% of the float was shorted as of Oct. 15; that's probably assisting with today's rally. Also higher: CSIQ +7.2%. GTAT +6.3%. RSOL +8.9%. YGE +3.7%. SUNE +2.4%. SOL +3.6%.
    • Update (12:35 PM): First Solar finally catches an upgrade: S&P has lifted shares all the way to Buy from Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • OCN

    Nationstar and Walter tumble along with Ocwen

    • Ocwen's (OCN -5%) near 10% 2-day tumble following disappointing earnings is spreading to mortgage servicing competitors Nationstar (NSM -3.5%) and Walter Investment (WAC -2.4%).
    • An interesting exchange on the earnings call (transcript) has analyst Ryan Zacharia puzzled about management blaming the OneWest and ResCap onboarding for the slow revenue number and margin fall. In Zacharia's mind, this timing was fully expected and he's curious for maybe something else behind the miss.
    • Big buy-side bull Steve Eisman also took part in the call and he notes a lot of the expected big MSR transactions (banks selling, Ocwen and the others buying) haven't actually panned out. This is inline with American Capital Mortgage CIO Kain's observation yesterday that the massive bank MSR sales many banked on haven't actually happened.
    • Earlier: Wells downgrades Ocwen after Q3 results.
    • Other Ocwen-related names: ASPS, RESI, AAMC.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 5 Comments
  • QUNR

    Qunar IPO more than doubles, Baidu's stake valued at $2.14B

    • After pricing its 11.1M-share IPO at $15 (above an elevated price range of $12-$14), Qunar (NASDAQ:QUNR) opened at $28.35 and is now at $32.30, up 115.3%. That gives the Chinese online travel site a valuation of $3.64B, which in turn means Baidu's (BIDU) 58.8% post-IPO stake is worth $2.14B.
    • For reference, Qunar had 2012 sales of just $81.7M, and 1H13 sales of $58.5M (+75% Y/Y).
    • Rivals Ctrip (CTRP +1.2%) and eLong (LONG +1.7%) are trading higher.
    • F-1, IPO preview
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • GTLS

    Chart Industries -6.2% after Piper downgrade

    • Chart Industries (GTLS -6.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Overweight with a reduced $105 price target (from $130) at Piper Jaffray following Q3 results that missed estimates.
    • The firm still thinks GTLS is the best way to invest in the global transition toward natural gas, but Q3 developments leave it seeking a more attractive entry point.
    • Management's tone on China seems to be shifting due to a lack of gas supply and corruption charges at PetroChina, a concern given recent momentum in Chinese orders; also operational problems unexpectedly drove margins lower for the second time in three quarters.
    • Shares are down sharply again today after yesterday's 12% drubbing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • WCG

    Cunningham out as CEO at WellCare

    • Wellcare Health Plans (WCG -8.8%) — which reported Q3 results earlier today — will replace CEO Alec Cunningham, whose employment was "terminated" effective yesterday.
    • Chairman David Gallitano will serve as interim CEO until a replacement is found. (8-K)
    • See also: Q3 numbers, Q3 summary, CC webcast
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy, LinnCo pop higher as SEC has no further comment on filing

    • Linn Energy (LINE +10.8%) and LinnCo (LNCO +10.9%) could be in the clear from the probe of their accounting activities, after the companies file an amended S-4 which says the SEC's Division of Corporation Finance has advised that it has no further comments on Amendment No. 6 to the Joint Registration Statement.
    • Hedgeye's Kevin Kaiser laments: "One of most expensive E&Ps in US. With zero organic growth and highly aggressive accounting. Who cares I guess."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 56 Comments
  • LKM

    NQ Mobile up again; more funds transferred, law firm hired

    • NQ Mobile (NQ +4.4%) shares are now up 68% from their Oct. 28 close, as the company continues a PR barrage in response to Muddy Waters' fraud allegations.
    • Today, NQ has announced the transfer of another $13M in cash to its account with the U.K.'s Standard Chartered Bank, as part of its previously-announced efforts to move $100M to the account. It has also announced the hiring of major law firm Shearman & Sterling to advise its board's special committee during its review of Muddy Waters' claims.
    • More on NQ Mobile
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • GBX

    Greenbrier Cos. climbs on FQ4 EPS beat, FY2014 guidance, $50M buyback, BofAML upgrade

    • Greenbrier Cos. (GBX +9%) shares are climbing after the company missed on revenue but soundly beat on EPS in FQ4.
    • Management guided for FY2014 EPS of $2.45-$2.70 (vs consensus of $2.47).
    • The board approved a $50M share repurchase authorization. (PR)
    • BofAML upgraded the stock 3 notches to Buy from Underperform while DA Davidson hiked its PT  to $34 from $28 and reiterated a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM

  • Treasury yields up as ISM hits highest in more than two years

    • At 56.4, it's the highest level for the index since April 2011. Both New Orders and Production were little-changed at 60.6 and 60.8, respectively. Employment -2.2 to 53.2. Supplier Deliveries +2.1 to 54.7. Backlogs +2.0 to 51.5. Exports +5.0 to 57.0.
    • It's the fifth consecutive gain for the ISM, after hitting a year-low of 49.0 in May.
    • Treasurys (TLT -0.9%) extend their losses with the 10-year yield all the way back to 2.61% after dropping to 2.48% earlier this week. TBT +1.4%.
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TTT, TMF, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, DLBS, VGLT, UBT, TLO, FSA, LBND, TENZ, TYBS, DLBL.
    • Full ISM report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 7 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook adds to post-earnings gains, Argus ups shares to Buy

    • Even though it quickly gave back the big AH gains it initially saw following its Q3 beat, Facebook (FB +2.7%) is now up 6% post-earnings. Today's gains come with the help of an upgrade to Buy from Argus, which praises Facebook's strong mobile growth and improving engagement.
    • Argus downgraded Facebook to Hold on July 26, shortly after the company's Q2 beat. Shares traded at $34 at the time.
    • JPMorgan joined the list of Facebook bulls defending the company yesterday; the firm argues rising advertiser interest in Facebook will allow the company to grow its news feed ad revenue via higher prices, even as ad load flattens.
    • Since the Q3 report, Facebook's 2014 EPS consensus has risen to $1.11 from $0.99. That still leaves the social networking kingpin trading at 43x 2014E EPS exc. cash.
    • Yesterday's sell-side commentary
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • ACRX

    AcelRx rallies as JPMorgan sees buying opportunity

    • JPMorgan is apparently out positive on AcelRx (ACRX +7.3%), after the stock suffered through a miserable October, falling nearly 40%.
    • According to market chatter, JPM cites the absence of insider selling and notes that The Medicines Company's (MDCO +0.4%) Ionsys (that's transdermal fentanyl) is not a viable competitor.
    • MDCO has said it plans to submit a supplemental NDA (acute postoperative pain) for Ionsys in the U.S. early next year.
    • See also: Cowen positive on ACRX amid selling
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • TCS

    Container Store IPO blows lid off in early trading

    • The Container Store's (NYSE:TCS) IPO blows a lid off, with shares up 99% from yesterday's announced pricing range of $18.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • GOLD

    JPM: Barrick dilution mitigated by progress in cost cutting

    • J.P. Morgan reiterates its Neutral rating on Barrick Gold (ABX -5.7%) and lifts its target price to $19 from $18 after the miner's launch of a $3B public equity offering to pay down debt and get its capital structure under control.
    • The equity issue could be a demonstration of financial prudence or it could suggest weaker than expected 2014 operating results, JPM says.
    • News of the suspension of the Pascua-Lama project and continuing cost cuts should strengthen ABX's near-term cash flow, the firm adds.
    • The equity issuance creates ~16% dilution, but the firm says simultaneous progress with current costs and the promise of another $500M in savings seems to mitigate the impact of the higher share count, assuming the cost cuts are sustainable.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • NOK

    A roundup of tech ratings changes

    • Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +3.5%) has been upgraded to Hold by SocGen a day after posting a Q3 beat fueled by margin expansion.
    • Lumos Networks (LMOS +4.9%) has been upgraded to Buy by D.A. Davidson a day after delivering its Q3 results.
    • Omnicell (OMCL -4.2%) has been cut to Hold by Craig-Hallum after providing mixed Q3 results.
    • Sony (SNE -1.8%) has been cut to Hold by Jefferies in the wake of Thursday's disappointing FQ2 results (I, II).
    • Iridium (IRDM -9.5%) has been cut to Outperform from Strong Buy by Raymond James a day after reporting a Q3 earnings miss and revenue beat.
    • Violin Memory (VMEM -2%) has been started at Neutral by Sterne Agee.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics -9.7% premarket; investments pressure EPS

    • Discussing its Q3 EPS (flat Y/Y and $0.03 below consensus), IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) says the figure "reflects the peak of [its] current investment cycle expanding manufacturing capacity, R&D and sales and marketing."
    • Those investments are set to affect Q4 results as well: The industrial laser vendor is guiding for Q4 revenue of $155M-$170M and EPS of $0.68-$0.82 vs. a consensus of $163.6M and $0.80. Demand is expected to be "seasonally weaker in certain areas."
    • Also hurting EPS: gross margin came in at 53.9%, +40 bps Q/Q but -110 bps Y/Y. R&D spend jumped 48% Y/Y to $11.5M, sales/marketing rose 17% to $6.8M; both growth rates exceeded revenue growth of 10%.
    • Asian sales rose 40% Y/Y thanks to strong Chinese/Turkish demand, but North American and European sales fell. IPG's core materials processing business saw 19% Y/Y sales growth, down from 26% in Q2 and 29% in Q1.
    • No mention in the PR of book-to-bill; in the Q2 report, IPG announced B2B "substantially exceeded 1."
    • COHR -1% in sympathy
    • Q3 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • EPRS

    Zalicus outlines Phase 1b data for Z944

    • Zalicus (ZLCS) announces results from a Phase 1b Z944 study.
    • The company used the LEP model to "compare the analgesic/anti-hyperalgesic properties of three different single doses of Z944 in a model of inflammatory pain and in a model of chronic neuropathic pain as compared with placebo."
    • Results: "Statistically significant and meaningful reductions at each of the three doses compared to placebo of overall PtP amplitude, consistent trends in reduction of subjective pain scores compared to placebo, Z944 was generally well tolerated with dose dependent CNS side effects."
    • No SAEs were observed.
    • The company also announces a second U.S. patent for Z944. (PR)
    • ZLCS +10 premarket (200 shares traded).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM

  • ACAD

    Acadia jumps as pimavanserin data published

    • Acadia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACAD) announces the publication of Phase 3 pimavanserin results in PDP.
    • The data, published today in The Lancet, shows "pimavanserin met the primary endpoint ... by demonstrating highly significant improvement in psychosis compared to placebo on the 9-item SAPS-PD scale."
    • "The mean change in SAPS-PD score represented a 37% improvement for pimavanserin versus 14% for placebo," the company notes. (PR)
    • ACAD +6% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • ARNA

    Belviq sales disappoint, Arena slides

    • Shares of Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) are down 4.5% in premarket trading on the heels of Belviq partner Eisai's H1 results.
    • Belviq sales for the six months ended September 30 were just $9M.
    • Backing out the $4.13M in sales the weight-loss drug saw during Eisai's FQ1 means quarterly sales were somewhere around $4.8-4.9M.
    • ARNA recognizes 31.5% of Belviq sales, equating to ~$1.53M for the quarter — consensus is $5.45M.

    AIG remains hopeful on ILFC sale

    • AIG is still working with the consortium and feels the ILFC deal can close as is, says CEO Bob Benmosche on the earnings call, but accounting rules will force the company in Q4 to make some choices, including maybe the decision to instead move forward with an IPO.

  • Global shares mixed following PMI data

    • Asian shares mostly rise following PMI data which showed that growth in Chinese factory activity accelerated in October. Readings for South Korea, Indonesia, Vietnam and Taiwan also indicated that manufacturing grew, although India remained in contraction.
    • European shares are solidly lower, but U.S. stock futures are higher following losses on Wall Street yesterday.
    • Japan -0.9%, Hong Kong +0.2%, China +0.4%, Hong Kong +0.2%.
    • EU Stoxx 50 -0.2%, London -0.1%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.2%, Milan -0.4%, Madrid -0.4%.
    • U.S. Stock futures: Dow +0.2%. S&P +0.1%. Nasdaq +0.2%.
